data.content:
noun
plural -stops
[count] baseball
a fence or screen that is placed behind the catcher to prevent the ball from rolling away
The pitch got past the catcher and rolled all the way to the backstop.
b informal :catcher
a talented backstop
[singular] Brit :something that is kept so that it can be used if it is needed
kept some gold as a backstop in case the value of the local currency collapsed
